headline.main: JAPAN OPENED.; Satisfactory Result of Commodore Perry's Visit. Three Ports Opened to American Trade. Agreement to Furnish Coal to American Steamers. INTERESTING NARRATIVE. Detailed Account of Commodore Perry's Second Visit

docs.lead_paragraph: The Susquehanna arrived at Hong Kong from Japan on the 2d (April), bringing the gratifying intelligence that Commodore PERRY had succeeded in the objects of his mission in a manner that will confer honor on his country and enduring fame on himself.
docs.snippet: The Susquehanna arrived at Hong Kong from Japan on the 2d (April), bringing the gratifying intelligence that Commodore PERRY had succeeded in the objects of his mission in a manner that will confer honor on his country and enduring fame on himself.

docs.lead_paragraph: As to the health of the City, all but those in authority have occasion to take comfort and be of good cheer. The Inspector reports for last week 408 deaths, less by 17 than the previous week. Sickness has not been general, and no epidemics are more than usually prevalent. More than half of those who died had not attained to the eleventh birth day.

headline.main: FRANCE.; The Austre-Prussian Treaty--Five Conscripts out of one Family--Alexander Dumas-??--Res-bif and God-dem.

docs.lead_paragraph: Well, the long agony is over. Austria and Prussia have informed the world that they are to act in concert in the impending struggle, and that in certain given cases they will simultaneously repel any attack, and that in certain other specified conjunctures, they will combinedly take up the offensive against Russia.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Dedication of St. Lawrence's Church. Sermon by Archbishop Hughes.

docs.lead_paragraph: The dedication ceremonies of the new Roman Catholic church erected under the patronage of St. Lawrence, in Yorkviile, were performed yesterday by Arch bishop HUQHES, assisted by the very Rev. Dr. STARES is the celebrant priest, Rev. WALTER I. QUARTERS Pastor, and several other clergymen.

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE PACIFIC. Latest Intelligence from the Seat of War. RUMORED RENEWAL OF NEGOTIATIONS. Rise in British Consols. FLOUR LOWER--COTTON BETTER. Miscellaneous News.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. mail steamer Pacific, which left Liverpool at 1 P. M., on the afternoon of Wednesday, May 31, arrived last evening. In lat. 46[degrees], lon 49[degrees], she passed the bark Princeton, of Wales, bound in, June 7; on the same day, she passed the British bark Chas. Totten, bound west; on the 10th passed a ship bound west, supposed to be a Philadelphia packet, but could not distinguish signals.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Continent of Africa is like such a great potato as Irishmen are said to enjoy best--one with a bone in it. Geographers make easy work with the outside, but they cannot set their teeth into the bone in its centre. In old books they used to call Africa the dry nurse of lions.

headline.main: RELIGIOUS LIBERTY.; Archbishop Hughes, in Reply to General Cass, and in Self-Vindication.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some persons imaging that a high honor has been conferred on me by the importance assigned o my name in the great speech which General CASS has thought proper to pronounce in the Senate of the United States. The providence of God has directed that General CASS should serve not only his country but his race in one order of life, and that it should be my humble privilege to serve both in another.
docs.abstract: Reply to Gen Cass on religious toleration
